bullets.text: Nvidia invests $5B in Intel for AI chip collaboration; Intel shares surge, signaling deepening partnership across data center and PC silicon.
China restricts Nvidia AI chips; Huawei unveils new AI infrastructure, accelerating domestic alternatives and U.S.-China tech decoupling.
Fed cuts rates, but Treasury yields rise as Powell signals no sprint to loosen policy; market expects gradual easing path.
Fed cut sets stage for Asia easing; Japan core inflation hits lowest since 2024, Nikkei reaches record ahead of BOJ decision.
FedEx beats expectations and points to easing trade uncertainty; shares rise on improved demand and efficiency.
Cybersecurity firm Netskope jumps 18% in IPO, valuing it at $8.6B; underscores robust investor appetite for AI-driven security.
Google brings Gemini to Chrome for U.S. users, unveiling agentic browsing and shareable AI assistants.
Google and PayPal partner on agentic commerce, enabling AI-driven shopping flows and integrated payments.
Notion surpasses $500M annual revenue and launches AI agents for analysis and automation, intensifying competition with Microsoft.
American Express raises Platinum annual fee to $895 while adding perks, highlighting resilient high-end consumer demand.
Trump asks Supreme Court to allow firing Fed Governor Lisa Cook, escalating challenge to central bank independence.
RFK Jr.'s vaccine panel to vote on Hepatitis B and Covid shots, potentially affecting access and insurance coverage.
DACLab claims direct air capture uses less electricity than competitors, promising lower costs for CO2 removal.
NASA Perseverance finds new evidence of past habitability in Jezero crater, bolstering case for ancient Martian life-friendly environments.
Simple stool DNA test detects 90% of colorectal cancers, signaling a less invasive screening option.
